oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard for the 30th "Old Hickory" Division
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The postcard features features the insignia of the 30th Division with the title and number below. On the left appears a quote from Sir Douglas Haig that commends the division for their role in the attack on the Hindenburg Line. On the right is a list of the towns "captured" by the division. The note on the back is addressed to Miss Willie E. Bryan from W. R. A., who just returned to Camp Jackson, S. C., after serving overseas. It is postmarked April 1, 1919.
